column4: did anybody try setting console resolution to anything other than standard 640x480? how can I change console resolution? neither vga option seems to work.
do you have a graphics card?
an extra one?
no, is there one that is installed in your linux machine.
of course, it's GF 6800. when I used Fedora and 2.6.32, I used 0x346 mode. but now under 9.10 the vga option always results in 'deprecated' error
Have you installed the drivers?
hard to tell, I just did an almost complete install of Ubuntu, choosing mostly default packages.
the X have NV driver installed
You're using ubuntu desktop? There should be something in the System menu that will install drivers for you.
Using Ubuntu Studio. Which driver should I install?
Follow this tutorial right here. http://www.psychocats.net/ubuntu/nvidia
Nvidia 185 driver is installed and in use
Did you run nvidia x server settings?
how's X server relevant?
What are you trying to expand? The console windows?
I want to change text console resolution
Ahh, I didn't understand your question then. Sorry mate.
not a problem
You can edit /boot/grub/menu.lst file to your specification if you want to change console size.
I know, that's what I tried. But the kernel throws an error for every vga option I tried, including the modes listed by vbeinfo
Did you update grub after changing the settings?
:) Of course, that's how I got the errors
